text.more:
The graph was constructed by combining three edge tables (tables that contain connecting pairs): 

- female African American visual artists, connected by sub-discipline and education.
- Renaissance artists, connected by era, sub-discipline, and citizenship.
- connections between the two groups on the basis of whether or not they are classed as a sculptor and co-existence in the same museum collections.
text.intro: This graph shows three types of connections: connections among female African American artists, among Renaissance artists (all men), and between the two groups. Click below to learn more about the process behind this graph.
text.title: Connections Among Renaissance and female African American Artists
